titles.title: Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 1ra–27vb), incomplete (?)

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased (s. fols. 4va, 5va, 27vb). The name of Gäbrä Libanos is written over erasure in pen (s. fol. 27vb).

txstates.txstate: Condition before the conservation work on 25.11.2011. The back board is broken and repaired. The original sewing is missing; most of the fols. are separate, kept together by crude recent stitches and guards (e.g., fols. 1r, 8r, 13v, 14r, 16v, 17r, 20v, 21r, 24v, 25r, 27v). A few fols. are missing. The Ms. is affected by humidity, esp. in the upper margins of the fols. Some parts of text are washed out (esp. in fols. 14vb ls. 5-13 l.16; 26ra ls. 3-4; 27ra ls. 3-4; 27vb ls. 8-9, 14-16). Before fol. 8, one or two fols. are missing. Crude notes in pen and in pencil are written in the upper margin of most of the fols. Holes in fols. 11, 16, 18.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (back board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: The original structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms. It can be assumed as follows: A - I(7/fols. 1r-7v) – II(8/fols. 7a-14v) – III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – IV(5/fols. 23r-27v) - B.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are poorly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. In fol. 1, the two ruling lines at the top have been not used by the scribe.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; three lines (both columns) on the incipit page, alterning with black lines; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: A leaf belonging to the Ms. (now foliated fols. 7a) was found in a bunch of leaves UM-038 (foliated there as fol. 24 [to be numbered as fol. 7a]) and incorporated into the codex during the conservation work on 25.11.2011. However, some two fols. are still missing. Quire structure before 25.11.2011: I(7/fols. 1r-7v) – II(5/fols. 8r-12v) – III(3/fols. 14r-16v) – IV(4/fols. 17r–20v) – V(4/fols. 21r–24v) – VI(3/fols. 25r-27v).

desccontent.text: I. Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”
desccontent.author: Ascribed to Jaqob of Serug
desccontent.completeness: Incomplete; 1 or 2 fols. are missing before fol. 8r, fol. 13r not photographed.
desccontent.mss: D´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.), fols. 80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139). EMML no. 378 (1959/70), fols. 1r-23v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 93; Church of St. Gabriel, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 400 (late 19th cent.), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 624 (1908), fols. 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mәḥrätu, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 885 (1916/30), fols. 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1512 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-4v, 71rv, 100v-107r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 12; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1589 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-30v: “Dersāna sanbat, attributed to James of Sarug” (EMML V, 77; Private library of Dr. Abraham Demoz, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-22v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyorgis, Gubalafto, Wällo). EMML no. 1672 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gäbrä Mäsqäl Täsfaye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2190 (1779/1800), fols. 124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2323 (1923/24), fols. 3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Mädḫane ʿAläm, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2392 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 2726 (1775-1809), fols. 4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannәs, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3200 (17th cent.), fols. 2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikaʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa). EMML no. 3341 (1755/69, 1769/96), fols. 48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Maryam, ʾAsagәrt, Shoa). EMML no. 3472 (18th cent.), fols. 146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Täklä Haymanot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo). EMML no. 3965 (20th cent.), fols. 2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gәnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa). EMML no. 4017 (18th/19th cent.), fols. 122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Maryam, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4362 (19th cent.), fols. 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikaʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4435 (1891), fols. 182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dәnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 18, fols. 121r-138v: “Homilia Jacobi Sarugensis de Sabbatho” (DillmLond 22). StrRyMan 7 (17th/18th cent.), fols. 44v-49r: “Sermon of Jacob of Serug” (StrJRyM 14). StrANL Conti Rossini 71 (19th/20th cent.), fols. 62rb-64vb: “Sermon de Jacques de Seroug” (StrANL 188). TelAviv, Library Faitllovitch, 34 (18th cent.), fols. 1-28 (cp. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 344).

edition.text: ድርሳነ፡ ሰንበት፡ (Dǝrsanä sänbät, ‘Homily of the Sabbathʼ), ed. by ʾabba GÄBRÄ KIDAN BÄZZABBƎH – ʾaggafari GÄBRÄ IYÄSUS – MÄŠÄŠA GƎZZAW; Addis Abäba 1947 A.M. [1954/55 A.D.]; ibid. ed. by TÄSFA GÄBRÄ ŚƎLLASE, Addis Abäba 1959 A.M. [1966/67 A.D.]. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 343-61.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 1ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. The homily which ˀabba Jaqob of Serug composed on St. Sabbath, which the Orthodox in faith ˀabba Jaqob composed. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the Church, about her greatness and her glory. The Father sanctified her, the Son elevated her and the Holy Spirit blessed her. And having setted to create everything, the Lord rested during the day of the Sabbath of Christians. …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 27rb, l.10: ... With the prayer and entreaty of St. Mary, Mother of God, and of John the Baptist, and George, big martyr powerful maker of the miracle, of Stephan, protomartyr, well anchored ... (?), and all the saints and martyrs who pleased the Lord with their life. Forever and ever. Amen. Amen and Amen. For the one who wrote it and for the one who caused it be written, and for the one who read it, and for the one who listened to its words, may He have mercy upon them all together in the Kingdom of Heaven, may He have mercy upon them. Amen and Amen. This is the book of <...> May He write his name with his children in the Kingdom of Heaven. Amen and Amen. <...>

extras.extra: - The two writing lines at the top have not been used by the scribe: fol. 1. - Correction over erasion, in the main hand (?): fol. 2vb. - Omitted word written interlineally: fol. 3ra. - A portion of the text is washed out: fol. 14vb. - A design of black cross in the upper margin (cp. StrANL, tables 1, 2): fol. 7a. - Crude recent pagination, in blue pencil.
